private_information: I arrive at Alamo Square at 09:00
I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I can travel between locations using the given travel times
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met while ensuring required meetings (e.g., with Matthew) are satisfied

private_information: I will be at Sunset District from 13:30 to 14:30
I would like to meet the traveler for at least 15 minutes during that window
matthew.goal: Meet the traveler at Sunset District for at least 15 minutes between 13:30 and 14:30

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent schedules and produce a PDDL domain and problem (for FastDownwards) that maximizes meetings while satisfying temporal and travel constraints

public_information: You arrive at Alamo Square at 09:00
Matthew will be at Sunset District from 13:30 to 14:30
You would like to meet Matthew for a minimum of 15 minutes
Travel time from Alamo Square to Sunset District is 16 minutes
Travel time from Sunset District to Alamo Square is 17 minutes

planning.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning your day. Provide feasible meeting time proposals, possible visit durations, and preferred sequencing given the public information and your private knowledge. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on candidate time slots, earliest departure times, travel time implications, and any flexibility in meeting durations.
planning.prompt: Your name is traveler. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->traveler->goal}. Provide a list of candidate meeting time slots with expected travel departure/arrival times and minimal meeting durations you can accept. If some information is missing, state assumptions explicitly as proposals rather than facts.

planning.system_prompt: You are Matthew providing availability details and meeting preferences. Provide clear availability windows, minimal acceptable meeting length, and any strict constraints. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on precise temporal availability and any flexibility.
planning.prompt: Your name is matthew. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->matthew->private_information}. Your goal is: {agents->matthew->goal}. Provide your confirmed availability windows, the minimum meeting duration you require, and any constraints about meeting location or timing. If you can be flexible, provide alternative shorter or longer windows.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate the schedule proposals from agents and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem specifically designed to be solved with the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct and model temporal constraints, travel durations, meeting durations, time windows, and an objective to maximize the number of friends met while ensuring required meetings (e.g., Matthew) meet their minimum duration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not rely on external assumptions unless those assumptions were presented; if you must assume something, state it clearly in comments within the PDDL problem file.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the traveler's proposals and Matthew's availability: {traveler_schedule_snippet} and {matthew_schedule_snippet}. Your task is to integrate these inputs and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that captures: locations, travel durations, arrival time at Alamo Square at 09:00, Matthew's availability window 13:30-14:30, a required meeting with Matthew of at least 15 minutes, and an objective to maximize the number of friends met (here modeled as meeting goals). Keep actions and predicates clearly scoped to each agent. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
